content: That is the role of the trash folder, providing a staging area where you can recover when deleting by accident. Once you empty the trash, you've lost it.
creator: davidsk

content: I presume the menu bar disappeared? If so, click the Alt key and it should reappear and you can then click View>Toolbars and tick 'menu bar.'
creator: davidsk

content: There are two ways that I am aware of: - set the account as a POP account, downloading to PC and deleting from server. - set as IMAP account, COPY messages to local folder and then delete from account.
creator: davidsk

creator: dhanslip

content: Is this an IMAP account? And you have your own domain name and switched from one host to another? Please clarify the details. My 'guess' is that, if it is iMAP, the messages were still appearing on Thunderbird, but with a new server, there were no messages on the new server. So, since IMAP sync's to the server, the messages on PC would have been deleted. With more details, I may have guessed wrong.
creator: davidsk

content: - If menu bar not show, click alt key - now, click view>messages>all
creator: davidsk

content:
Remove the entries from Saved Passwords in Settings, create a secure mail key for each account on the AT&T site, restart TB, enter the keys when asked for a password.

https://www.att.com/support/article/dsl-high-speed/KM1010523/
creator: sfhowes

content: Knowing the explicit text of the bounce messages might be helpful.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thunderbird Supernova 151.10.1 è la versione installata

Ho provato ad usare la modalità "risoluzione problemi" (anche se non ho componenti aggiuntivi) di Thunderbird e a disattivare l'accelerazione grafica (uso un amd r7 360) senza risultati.

Ho un altro pc con la stessa versione di Thunderbird e del sistema operativo(ed hardware simile) che non ha questo problema.
creator: alfaomega76

content: posting the complete text of the message may prove useful. Thank you. This often happens when the email id on the SMTP server does not match the email id of the sender.
creator: davidsk

content:
Remove the entries from Saved Passwords, generate a new secure mail key on the AT&T site, restart TB, enter the key when asked for a password.

https://www.att.com/support/article/dsl-high-speed/KM1010523/
creator: sfhowes
